subject: Re: [PATCHv6 06/17] LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size

reviews.author: Kiryl Shutsemau (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Kiryl Shutsemau, raised no specific technical concerns or objections to the patch, but instead responded to comments from other reviewers.

reviews.author: Muchun Song
reviews.summary: Muchun Song reviewed several patches, including LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size, and provided Reviewed-by tags for most of them.

reviews.author: David (arm)
reviews.summary: David (arm) raised concerns about the alignment of vmemmap to maximal folio size, specifically questioning whether it's possible for a folio to cross zones and suggesting that HVO should not be possible for certain sizes.

reviews.author: Usama Arif
reviews.summary: Reviewer Usama Arif pointed out that the patch does not work for ARM, specifically due to undefined behavior when calculating the order of huge pages using ilog2(). He suggested an alternative calculation using ilog2(len / sizeof(struct page)) and acknowledged some patches with Acked-by.

reviews.author: Vlastimil Babka
reviews.summary: Vlastimil Babka expressed concerns about the patch 'LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size' and suggested an alternative approach, specifically questioning whether shared tail pages should be per node or per node+zone.

reviews.author: Matthew Wilcox
reviews.summary: Matthew Wilcox questioned the correctness of returning the zone number of the head page instead of the current page's zone number, suggesting that the caller might not care about the head page's zone number.
